Articles.Content: I'm genuinely sorry for all the spam post i've been making on my Eve post (im almost done) but I realized I never actually introduced myself. Welllll I'm Reinhart and in the past I mainly played ww2 flight sims (primarily on the German side which you can probably guess from the name) but that got exhausting after awhile since I played MP full realism servers and made survival and combat effectiveness top priority so I took a break. Me and a friend discovered KSP years ago and would literally spend all hours of the night trying to even get a rocket into orbit. Flashback to now and I've learned enough about the game to make complex ships and travel to other celestial bodies almost routinely and I this has to be pound for pound the greatest game of all time (in my eyes at least). Anyway this community has been VERY helpful and kind to me right from the jump so I'm hoping I can be as helpful in anyway I can and kinda give back to the community with quality videos. Okay that's my intro, hope yall are having a good day <3

Let me be the first to formally welcome you to the KSP Forum, Reinhart Mk.1!

You have nothing for which to be apologetic.  Many people who have been helped previously are happy to help a newcomer learn the ropes.
Especially when that newcomer is truly interested in learning.

I am glad your experiences here have been so positive.


Happy landings!

Welcome to the forum, @Reinhart Mk.1.

I've been following your Eve thread and find very informative - it has generated a lot of great discussion, ideas and even a duel challenge.  I've also never made it back to orbit from the purple beast so I wish you the best of luck, Mate, I hope you conquer it.  I'm starting to think about giving it a go again myself.

Just now, James Kerman said:

I'm starting to think about giving it a go again myself.

You got it in you buddy, CHASE YOUR DREAMS <3
Oh, welcome there, Mister...wish you can have fun in any ways you want...
